Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sultry \Sul"try\ (s[u^]l"tr[y^]), a. [Compar. {Sultrier} (s[u^]l"tr[i^]*[~e]r); superl. {Sultriest}.] [From {Sweltry}.] 1. Very hot, burning, and oppressive; as, Libya's sultry deserts. [1913 Webster]
Such as, born beneath the burning sky And sultry sun, betwixt the tropics lie. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
2. Very hot and humid, or hot, close, stagnant, and oppressive, as air. [1913 Webster]
When in the sultry glebe I faint, Or on the thirsty mountain plant. --Addison. [1913 Webster]

sultry adj 1: sexually exciting or gratifying; "sensual excesses"; "a sultry look"; "a sultry dance" [syn: {sensual}] 2: characterized by oppressive heat and humidity; "the summer was sultry and oppressive"; "the stifling atmosphere"; "the sulfurous atmosphere preceding a thunderstorm" [syn: {stifling}, {sulfurous}, {sulphurous}] 3: burning hot; extremely and unpleasantly hot; "the torrid noonday sun"; "sultry sands of the dessert" [syn: {torrid}] [also: {sultriest}, {sultrier}]
